titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I celebrated the Holy Communion in the Chapel at 8 a.m. We numbered but six communicants in all. After breakfast, I finished the sermon, and then wrote to
, sending him a copy of the
with my E. R. Article on the Revised Prayer Book.
After lunch I wrote to George Nimmins and to Mary Radford. M

Bonofield came to tea with her daughter Marjorie, who had given my name as reference to a training college for secretaries, & whom I desired to see before answering the secretary's inquiries. I liked her, & wrote accordingly.
Ella and I went to South Church, where I preached the sermon on "Change & Continuity". The Vicar read the prayers, and I read the Lessons.
